# spring-security-rest-keycloak

Example REST application utilizing [Keycloak](http://www.keycloak.org) for 
managing. 

Read the blog post [here](https://sandor-nemeth.github.io/java/spring/2017/06/15/spring-boot-with-keycloak.html)

docker run -d \
  --name keycloak \
  -e KEYCLOAK_USER=admin \
  -e KEYCLOAK_PASSWORD=admin \
  -p 9001:8080 \
  jboss/keycloak
  
  
Example: 
curl -i http://localhost:9002/storage-systems/hello -H "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJtbld0OHp4c0RQY1gwdXNaMUh3S0k3OF9lREY1d3FjVl9yUHBCR2g1ZDNzIn0..YuwayCbw__Br24xzq2hNL4vplkDltGIacbTXOQ5aPqLReQyZcSERlhT_xAJTiS9IPUfyfDOOIJjb51zozTE2S4F7_ebWRPlc7-_OHrF4nKst3IAxu6c35N6YnhzAu0ALMpzfF72z-I6NUki8Mo6CEVEFzRN9iQpgPD_ne0RFUJT414-TTuO_KGktZ0jm9710KVGifmZ9y1LlAskZK7kBZivhTjOLTcQvKcdCyB_HOnX0vQW2l_7pAV0qUzm9K1spJ7z32Y1nNkMumJunYZAC_FEyH2x7DrZqK0ZW6rBp6qe1lqJID4wFu53U0Ygo9OkWi7-k9WM9gQfnZxlh06yd1g"

It should return 401
